content.raw: I found a problem in one of the examples in `haptix_comm`. See [this pull request](#!/osrf/haptix-comm/pull-requests/83). Could you try running the tests locally? All the tests pass on my machine. If this is the case, why don't we merge the pull request and then look at what is the problem in Jenkins? (because I don't think it's related with this pull request). I think it should be fixed on Jenkins when we start using the gazebo-haptix package.
content.html: I found a problem in one of the examples in haptix_comm. See this pull request. Could you try running the tests locally? All the tests pass on my machine. If this is the case, why don't we merge the pull request and then look at what is the problem in Jenkins? (because I don't think it's related with this pull request). I think it should be fixed on Jenkins when we start using the gazebo-haptix package.

content.raw:
I created a branch named `fix_tests` with all the fixes. I ran it locally and all tests passed for me (it takes a while). I tried the `handsim-any-devel-trusty-amd64-docker_test` in jenkins but [something is not working there](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/handsim/job/handsim-any-devel-trusty-amd64-docker_test/52/console). @_jrivero_ , could you check if there is a problem in the Jenkins job?

In the meantime, you can try this branch locally.
content.html:
I created a branch named fix_tests with all the fixes. I ran it locally and all tests passed for me (it takes a while). I tried the handsim-any-devel-trusty-amd64-docker_test in jenkins but something is not working there. @jrivero , could you check if there is a problem in the Jenkins job?

In the meantime, you can try this branch locally.
